name.text: Classifying a given number as odd, even, prime or composite

questiontext.text:
During a math lesson, Grade 10 students were asked to classify the number {@seven_digit@} as even, odd, prime or composite.

Which of the following are true about this number? Select all that apply: [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked Solution

Given the number: {@seven_digit@}:

Test if it is Even or Odd :

Check the last digit

{@if is_even then sconcat("Since the last digit is (", mod(seven_digit, 10), ") it is even.") else sconcat("Since the last digit is (", mod(seven_digit, 10), ") it is odd.") @}

Check if it is Prime or Composite:

{@if seven_digit = 1 then "1 is a special number: neither prime nor composite." else if is_prime_num then sconcat("After testing divisibility up to ", floor(sqrt(seven_digit)), ", no divisors found except 1 and itself. Therefore, it is prime.") else block([factor: composite_factor], sconcat(seven_digit, " รท ", factor, " = ", seven_digit/factor, "
Since it has a divisor other than 1 and itself, it is composite.") ) @}

Therefore, {@seven_digit@} is {@t_ans1@}
